PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'peculiarities' in the following text:  The art of change-ringing is peculiar to the English , and , like most English peculiarities , unintelligible to the rest of the world .

I) an odd or unusual characteristic
II) a distinguishing trait
III) something unusual -- perhaps worthy of collecting

RESULT: I) an odd or unusual characteristic
Gold answer is: 2
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'rest' in the following text:  The art of change-ringing is peculiar to the English , and , like most English peculiarities , unintelligible to the rest of the world .

I) something left after other parts have been taken away
II) freedom from activity (work or strain or responsibility)
III) a pause for relaxation
IV) a state of inaction
V) euphemisms for death (based on an analogy between lying in a bed and in a tomb)
VI) a support on which things can be put
VII) a musical notation indicating a silence of a specified duration

RESULT: II) freedom from activity (work or strain or responsibility)
Gold answer is: 1
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'evoke' in the following text:  Of all scenes that evoke rural England , this is one of the loveliest : An ancient stone church stands amid the fields , the sound of bells cascading from its tower , calling the faithful to evensong .

I) call forth (emotions, feelings, and responses)
II) evoke or provoke to appear or occur
III) deduce (a principle) or construe (a meaning)
IV) summon into action or bring into existence, often as if by magic
V) call to mind

RESULT: I) call forth (emotions, feelings, and responses)
Gold answer is: 5
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'rural' in the following text:  Of all scenes that evoke rural England , this is one of the loveliest : An ancient stone church stands amid the fields , the sound of bells cascading from its tower , calling the faithful to evensong .

I) living in or characteristic of farming or country life
II) of or relating to the countryside as opposed to the city

RESULT: II) of or relating to the countryside as opposed to the city
Gold answer is: 1
========

II) an interval during which a recurring sequence of events occurs
III) a regular route for a sentry or policeman
IV) (often plural) a series of professional calls (usually in a set order)
V) the activity of playing 18 holes of golf
VI) the usual activities in your day
VII) (sports) a division during which one team is on the offensive
VIII) the course along which communications spread
IX) a serving to each of a group (usually alcoholic)
X) a cut of beef between the rump and the lower leg
XI) a partsong in which voices follow each other; one voice starts and others join in one after another until all are singing different parts of the song at the same time
XII) an outburst of applause
XIII) a crosspiece between the legs of a chair
XIV) any circular or rotating mechanism

RESULT: XI) a partsong in which voices follow each other; one voice starts and others join in one after another until all are singing different parts of the song at the same time
Gold answer is: 2
========

V) the third from the lowest forward ratio gear in the gear box of a motor vehicle

V) come into existence; take on form or shape
VI) change the use of and make available or usable
VII) elaborate, as of theories and hypotheses
VIII) create by training and teaching
IX) be gradually disclosed or unfolded; become manifest
X) grow, progress, unfold, or evolve through a process of evolution, natural growth, differentiation, or a conducive environment
XI) become technologically advanced
XII) cause to grow and differentiate in ways conforming to its natural development
XIII) generate gradually
XIV) grow emotionally or mature
XV) make visible by means of chemical solutions
XVI) superimpose a three-dimensional surface on a plane without stretching, in geometry
XVII) move one's pieces into strategically more advantageous positions
XVIII) move into a strategically more advantageous position
XIX) elaborate by the unfolding of a musical idea and by the working out of the rhythmic and harmonic changes in the theme
XX) happen
XXI) expand in the form of a series

RESULT: X) grow, progress, unfold, or evolve through a process of evolution, natural growth, differentiation, or a conducive environment
Gold answer is: 5
========

I) occurring among members of a family usually by heredity
II) of or relating to or produced by or being a gene
III) pertaining to or referring to origin
IV) of or relating to the science of genetics

RESULT: II) of or relating to or produced by or being a gene

RESULT: III) make or cause to be or to become
Gold answer is: 2

III) have or feel a need for

RESULT: III) have or feel a need for
Gold answer is: 1

X) an arrangement of the elements in a composition or discourse
XI) a particular mode in which something is manifested
XII) (physical chemistry) a distinct state of matter in a system; matter that is identical in chemical composition and physical state and separated from other material by the phase boundary
XIII) a body of students who are taught together
XIV) an ability to perform well
XV) a life-size dummy used to display clothes
XVI) a mold for setting concrete

RESULT: VI) the spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance
Gold answer is: 11
========

II) a causal agent creating and controlling things in the universe

XI) (architecture) solid exterior angle of a building; especially one formed by a cornerstone

RESULT: I) a place off to the side of an area
Gold answer is: 3

V) a depression forming the ground under a body of water
VI) low-lying alluvial land near a river
VII) a cargo ship

RESULT: I) the lower side of anything
Gold answer is: 2
========

II) travel backward
III) give support or one's approval to
IV) cause to travel backward
V) support financial backing for
VI) be in back of
VII) place a bet on
VIII) shift to a counterclockwise direction

RESULT: III) give support or one's approval to

III) consider (oneself) as similar to somebody else
IV) conceive of as united or associated
V) identify as in botany or biology, for example
VI) consider to be equal or the same

RESULT: I) recognize as being; establish the identity of someone or something
Gold answer is: 2
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'living' in the following text:  I guess we 're all living very tentatively here , waiting for the expected but dreaded aftershock .

I) inhabit or live in; be an inhabitant of
II) lead a certain kind of life; live in a certain style
III) continue to live through hardship or adversity
IV) support oneself
V) have life, be alive
VI) have firsthand knowledge of states, situations, emotions, or sensations
VII) pursue a positive and satisfying existence

RESULT: III) continue to live through hardship or adversity
Gold answer is: 2
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'waiting' in the following text:  I guess we 're all living very tentatively here , waiting for the expected but dreaded aftershock .

I) stay in one place and anticipate or expect something
II) wait before acting
III) look forward to the probable occurrence of
IV) serve as a waiter or waitress in a restaurant

RESULT: I) stay in one place and anticipate or expect something
Gold answer is: 3
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'able' in the following text:  I wonder when we 'll be able to relax .

I) (usually followed by `to') having the necessary means or skill or know-how or authority to do something
II) have the skills and qualifications to do things well
III) having inherent physical or mental ability or capacity
IV) having a strong healthy body

RESULT: I) (usually followed by `to') having the necessary means or skill or know-how or authority to do something
Gold answer is: 3
========

III) a soft moist part of a fruit

I) express in words
II) report or maintain
III) express a supposition
IV) have or contain a certain wording or form
V) give instructions to or direct somebody to do something with authority
VI) speak, pronounce, or utter in a certain way
VII) communicate or express nonverbally
VIII) utter aloud
IX) state as one's opinion or judgement; declare
X) recite or repeat a fixed text
XI) indicate

RESULT: VIII) utter aloud
Gold answer is: 1

II) protective covering that provides protection from the weather

II) the act of marching; walking with regular steps (especially in a procession of some kind)

IV) a procession of people walking together

XVIII) attract and fix
XIX) reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot
XX) reach by calculation
XXI) acquire as a result of some effort or action
XXII) purchase
XXIII) perceive by hearing
XXIV) suffer from the receipt of
XXV) receive as a retribution or punishment
XXVI) leave immediately; used usually in the imperative form
XXVII) reach and board
XXVIII) irritate
XXIX) evoke an emotional response
XXX) apprehend and reproduce accurately
XXXI) earn or achieve a base by being walked by the pitcher
XXXII) overcome or destroy
XXXIII) be a mystery or bewildering to
XXXIV) take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
XXXV) undergo (as of injuries and illnesses)
XXXVI) make children

RESULT: XXI) acquire as a result of some effort or action
Gold answer is: 1

VIII) the act of bearing the weight of or strengthening

XI) financial resources provided to make some project possible

RESULT: II) aiding the cause or policy or interests of

X) cause to emit recorded audio or video

XIII) be operating, running or functioning
XIV) change from one state to another
XV) cause to perform
XVI) be affected by; be subjected to
XVII) continue to exist
XVIII) occur persistently
XIX) carry out a process or program, as on a computer or a machine
XX) include as the content; broadcast or publicize
XXI) carry out
XXII) pass over, across, or through

XXIV) make without a miss
XXV) deal in illegally, such as arms or liquor
XXVI) cause an animal to move fast
XXVII) be diffused
XXVIII) sail before the wind
XXIX) cover by running; run a certain distance
XXX) extend or continue for a certain period of time
XXXI) set animals loose to graze
XXXII) keep company
XXXIII) run with the ball; in such sports as football
XXXIV) travel rapidly, by any (unspecified) means
XXXV) travel a route regularly
XXXVI) pursue for food or sport (as of wild animals)

RESULT: III) stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope; run or extend between two points or beyond a certain point
Gold answer is: 8

III) a program exemplifying a contemplated series; intended to attract sponsors
IV) something that serves as a model or a basis for making copies
V) small auxiliary gas burner that provides a flame to ignite a larger gas burner
VI) an inclined metal frame at the front of a locomotive to clear the track

RESULT: II) a person qualified to guide ships through difficult waters going into or out of a harbor
Gold answer is: 1
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'plunged' in the following text:  `` Attention , `` yelled our pilot as our basket plunged into the canal .

I) thrust or throw into
II) drop steeply
III) dash violently or with great speed or impetuosity
IV) begin with vigor
V) cause to be immersed
VI) fall abruptly
VII) immerse briefly into a liquid so as to wet, coat, or saturate
VIII) devote (oneself) fully to

RESULT: II) drop steeply
Gold answer is: 6

II) (language) communication by word of mouth
III) the text of a popular song or musical-comedy number
IV) the cognitive processes involved in producing and understanding linguistic communication
V) the mental faculty or power of vocal communication
VI) a system of words used to name things in a particular discipline

RESULT: I) a systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds or conventional symbols
Gold answer is: 6
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'ones' in the following text:  U.S. special climate envoy Todd Stern rejected language requiring binding cuts of greenhouse-gas emissions for industrialized countries compared with voluntary ones by major emerging economies if they were not funded by the developed world .

II) a single person or thing

RESULT: I) the smallest whole number or a numeral representing this number
Gold answer is: 2

III) a change of position that does not entail a change of location

V) (game) a player's turn to take some action permitted by the rules of the game

IV) a period of time containing 365 (or 366) days

Gold answer is: 2

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'spite' in the following text:  In spite of this , and with Splitter fouling out , Ivonic 's team did n't rush , defended well , and , even though the Israelis came close at the last minute , the game was already won and victory escaped Tel Aviv for the first time in the season .

I) feeling a need to see others suffer
II) malevolence by virtue of being malicious or spiteful or nasty

RESULT: II) malevolence by virtue of being malicious or spiteful or nasty
Gold answer is: 1
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'game' in the following text:  In spite of this , and with Splitter fouling out , Ivonic 's team did n't rush , defended well , and , even though the Israelis came close at the last minute , the game was already won and victory escaped Tel Aviv for the first time in the season .

I) a contest with rules to determine a winner
II) a single play of a sport or other contest
III) an amusement or pastime
IV) animal hunted for food or sport
V) (tennis) a division of play during which one player serves
VI) (games) the score at a particular point or the score needed to win
VII) the flesh of wild animals that is used for food
VIII) a secret scheme to do something (especially something underhand or illegal)
IX) the game equipment needed in order to play a particular game
X) your occupation or line of work
XI) frivolous or trifling behavior

RESULT: I) a contest with rules to determine a winner
Gold answer is: 2

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'time' in the following text:  In spite of this , and with Splitter fouling out , Ivonic 's team did n't rush , defended well , and , even though the Israelis came close at the last minute , the game was already won and victory escaped Tel Aviv for the first time in the season .

I) an instance or single occasion for some event
II) a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something
III) an indefinite period (usually marked by specific attributes or activities)
IV) a suitable moment
V) the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
VI) a person's experience on a particular occasion
VII) a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
VIII) the fourth coordinate that is required (along with three spatial dimensions) to specify a physical event
IX) rhythm as given by division into parts of equal duration
X) the period of time a prisoner is imprisoned

RESULT: V) the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
Gold answer is: 1

III) approaching a particular destination; a coming closer; a narrowing of a gap

VIII) the impression produced by a person

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'points' in the following text:  According to final closing figures , the Dow Jones Industrial Average has risen by 65.67 points to 10 471.50 points , whereas the NASDAQ , with a technology predominance , fell by 0.55 point to 2 190.31 points .

I) a geometric element that has position but no extension
II) the precise location of something; a spatially limited location
III) a brief version of the essential meaning of something
IV) an isolated fact that is considered separately from the whole
V) a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process
VI) an instant of time
VII) the object of an activity
VIII) a V shape
IX) a very small circular shape
X) the unit of counting in scoring a game or contest
XI) a promontory extending out into a large body of water
XII) a distinct part that can be specified separately in a group of things that could be enumerated on a list
XIII) a style in speech or writing that arrests attention and has a penetrating or convincing quality or effect
XIV) an outstanding characteristic
XV) sharp end
XVI) any of 32 horizontal directions indicated on the card of a compass
XVII) a linear unit used to measure the size of type; approximately 1/72 inch
XVIII) one percent of the total principal of a loan; it is paid at the time the loan is made and is independent of the interest on the loan
XIX) a punctuation mark (.) placed at the end of a declarative sentence to indicate a full stop or after abbreviations
XX) a V-shaped mark at one end of an arrow pointer
XXI) the dot at the left of a decimal fraction
XXII) the property of a shape that tapers to a sharp tip
XXIII) a distinguishing or individuating characteristic
XXIV) the gun muzzle's direction
XXV) a wall socket
XXVI) a contact in the distributor; as the rotor turns its projecting arm contacts them and current flows to the spark plugs

RESULT: X) the unit of counting in scoring a game or contest
Gold answer is: 5

II) how a result is obtained or an end is achieved
III) a line leading to a place or point
IV) the condition of things generally
V) a course of conduct
VI) any artifact consisting of a road or path affording passage from one place to another
VII) a journey or passage
VIII) space for movement
IX) the property of distance in general
X) doing as one pleases or chooses
XI) a general category of things; used in the expression `in the way of'
XII) a portion of something divided into shares

RESULT: I) how something is done or how it happens
Gold answer is: 5
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'news' in the following text:  Iraq finally opened its doors after six years of war , and instead of U.S. companies , you have Asians and Europeans leading the way , said Ruba Husari , the editor of Iraq Oil Forum , an online news outlet .

I) information about recent and important events
II) information reported in a newspaper or news magazine
III) a program devoted to current events, often using interviews and commentary
IV) informal information of any kind that is not previously known to someone
V) the quality of being sufficiently interesting to be reported in news bulletins

RESULT: I) information about recent and important events
Gold answer is: 2

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'time' in the following text:  Some lawyers said appeals courts reviewing Mr. Hayes 's conviction half a century later might be intrigued by the argument that new rules could be necessary to govern ways of communicating from courtrooms unimagined at the time of Dr. Sheppard 's case .

I) an instance or single occasion for some event
II) a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something
III) an indefinite period (usually marked by specific attributes or activities)
IV) a suitable moment
V) the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
VI) a person's experience on a particular occasion
VII) a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
VIII) the fourth coordinate that is required (along with three spatial dimensions) to specify a physical event
IX) rhythm as given by division into parts of equal duration
X) the period of time a prisoner is imprisoned

RESULT: V) the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
Gold answer is: 1
========

V) a portable container for carrying several objects
VI) a person requiring professional services

VIII) a problem requiring investigation

X) the quantity contained in a case

RESULT: II) a special set of circumstances

XIV) a specific size and style of type within a type family
XV) an enveloping structure or covering enclosing an animal or plant organ or part
XVI) the housing or outer covering of something
XVII) the enclosing frame around a door or window opening
XVIII) (printing) the receptacle in which a compositor has his type, which is divided into compartments for the different letters, spaces, or numbers
XIX) bed linen consisting of a cover for a pillow
XX) a glass container used to store and display items in a shop or museum or home

RESULT: III) a comprehensive term for any proceeding in a court of law whereby an individual seeks a legal remedy
Gold answer is: 1
========

III) something intended to deceive; deliberate trickery intended to gain an advantage

RESULT: III) something intended to deceive; deliberate trickery intended to gain an advantage
Gold answer is: 1
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'country' in the following text:  But the mood varies widely from country to country ( see chart 4 ) .

I) a politically organized body of people under a single government
II) the territory occupied by a nation
III) the people who live in a nation or country
IV) an area outside of cities and towns
V) a particular geographical region of indefinite boundary (usually serving some special purpose or distinguished by its people or culture or geography)

RESULT: II) the territory occupied by a nation

X) an area wholly or partly surrounded by walls or buildings
XI) respectful deference

RESULT: VIII) a tribunal that is presided over by a magistrate or by one or more judges who administer justice according to the laws
Gold answer is: 1
========

''

I) a person who works at a specific occupation

VIII) military personnel lost by death or capture

RESULT: VII) the amount by which the cost of a business exceeds its revenue
Gold answer is: 2
========

VI) score an extra point or points after touchdown by kicking the ball through the uprights or advancing the ball into the end zone
VII) complete successfully
VIII) score (a spare)
IX) make (someone) agree, understand, or realize the truth or validity of something
X) exchange a penalty for a less severe one
XI) change in nature, purpose, or function; undergo a chemical change

RESULT: XI) change in nature, purpose, or function; undergo a chemical change
Gold answer is: 2
========

XI) undergo

XV) get something; come into possession of
XVI) undergo (as of injuries and illnesses)
XVII) achieve a point or goal
XVIII) cause to be born
XIX) have sex with; archaic use

RESULT: I) have or possess, either in a concrete or an abstract sense
Gold answer is: 16

VI) replay (as a melody)
VII) perform music on (a musical instrument)
VIII) pretend to have certain qualities or state of mind
IX) move or seem to move quickly, lightly, or irregularly
X) bet or wager (money)
XI) engage in recreational activities rather than work; occupy oneself in a diversion
XII) pretend to be somebody in the framework of a game or playful activity
XIII) emit recorded sound
XIV) perform on a certain location
XV) put (a card or piece) into play during a game, or act strategically as if in a card game
XVI) engage in an activity as if it were a game rather than take it seriously
XVII) behave in a certain way
XVIII) cause to emit recorded audio or video
XIX) manipulate manually or in one's mind or imagination
XX) use to one's advantage
XXI) consider not very seriously
XXII) be received or accepted or interpreted in a specific way
XXIII) behave carelessly or indifferently
XXIV) cause to move or operate freely within a bounded space
XXV) perform on a stage or theater
XXVI) be performed or presented for public viewing
XXVII) cause to happen or to occur as a consequence
XXVIII) discharge or direct or be discharged or directed as if in a continuous stream
XXIX) make bets
XXX) stake on the outcome of an issue
XXXI) shoot or hit in a particular manner
XXXII) use or move
XXXIII) employ in a game or in a specific position
XXXIV) contend against an opponent in a sport, game, or battle
XXXV) exhaust by allowing to pull on the line

RESULT: IV) play a role or part
Gold answer is: 2
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'able' in the following text:  The treatment of a vomiting dog should be started with the injection , since vomiting animals might not be able to keep a tablet down ( as they might throw the intact tablet up again ) .

I) (usually followed by `to') having the necessary means or skill or know-how or authority to do something
II) have the skills and qualifications to do things well
III) having inherent physical or mental ability or capacity
IV) having a strong healthy body

RESULT: I) (usually followed by `to') having the necessary means or skill or know-how or authority to do something
Gold answer is: 3
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'intact' in the following text:  The treatment of a vomiting dog should be started with the injection , since vomiting animals might not be able to keep a tablet down ( as they might throw the intact tablet up again ) .

I) constituting the undiminished entirety; lacking nothing essential especially not damaged; - Bacon
II) (of a woman) having the hymen unbroken
III) (used of domestic animals) sexually competent
IV) undamaged in any way

RESULT: I) constituting the undiminished entirety; lacking nothing essential especially not damaged; - Bacon
Gold answer is: 4
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'follow-up' in the following text:  For follow-up treatment , the animal owner can administer the tablets to the dog .

I) a piece of work that exploits or builds on earlier work
II) an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done
III) a subsequent examination of a patient for the purpose of monitoring earlier treatment

RESULT: III) a subsequent examination of a patient for the purpose of monitoring earlier treatment
Gold answer is: 2
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'measure' in the following text:  Also , the treatment of vomiting should only be together with other supportive measure or other veterinary therapy while addressing the underlying causes of the vomiting .

I) any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal
II) how much there is or how many there are of something that you can quantify
III) a statute in draft before it becomes law
IV) the act or process of assigning numbers to phenomena according to a rule
V) a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated
VI) (prosody) the accent in a metrical foot of verse
VII) musical notation for a repeating pattern of musical beats
VIII) measuring instrument having a sequence of marks at regular intervals; used as a reference in making measurements
IX) a container of some standard capacity that is used to obtain fixed amounts of a substance

RESULT: II) how much there is or how many there are of something that you can quantify
Gold answer is: 1
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'generally' in the following text:  Cerenia was generally well tolerated when administered daily at dosages up to 5 times the recommended doses for an extended period of time ( up to 3 times the recommended maximum duration of treatment ) .

I) usually; as a rule
II) without distinction of one from others
III) without regard to specific details or exceptions

RESULT: I) usually; as a rule
Gold answer is: 2
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'times' in the following text:  Cerenia was generally well tolerated when administered daily at dosages up to 5 times the recommended doses for an extended period of time ( up to 3 times the recommended maximum duration of treatment ) .

I) a more or less definite period of time now or previously present
II) an arithmetic operation that is the inverse of division; the product of two numbers is computed
III) an instance or single occasion for some event
IV) a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something
V) an indefinite period (usually marked by specific attributes or activities)
VI) a suitable moment
VII) the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
VIII) a person's experience on a particular occasion
IX) a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
X) the fourth coordinate that is required (along with three spatial dimensions) to specify a physical event
XI) rhythm as given by division into parts of equal duration
XII) the period of time a prisoner is imprisoned

RESULT: I) a more or less definite period of time now or previously present
Gold answer is: 3
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'recommended' in the following text:  Cerenia was generally well tolerated when administered daily at dosages up to 5 times the recommended doses for an extended period of time ( up to 3 times the recommended maximum duration of treatment ) .

I) push for something
II) express a good opinion of
III) make attractive or acceptable

RESULT: II) express a good opinion of
Gold answer is: 1
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'times' in the following text:  Cerenia was generally well tolerated when administered daily at dosages up to 5 times the recommended doses for an extended period of time ( up to 3 times the recommended maximum duration of treatment ) .

I) a more or less definite period of time now or previously present
II) an arithmetic operation that is the inverse of division; the product of two numbers is computed
III) an instance or single occasion for some event
IV) a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something
V) an indefinite period (usually marked by specific attributes or activities)
VI) a suitable moment
VII) the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
VIII) a person's experience on a particular occasion
IX) a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
X) the fourth coordinate that is required (along with three spatial dimensions) to specify a physical event
XI) rhythm as given by division into parts of equal duration
XII) the period of time a prisoner is imprisoned

RESULT: I) a more or less definite period of time now or previously present
Gold answer is: 3

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'represent' in the following text:  Cerenia does not represent a particular risk for people .

I) take the place of or be parallel or equivalent to
II) express indirectly by an image, form, or model; be a symbol
III) be representative or typical for
IV) be a delegate or spokesperson for; represent somebody's interest or be a proxy or substitute for, as of politicians and office holders representing their constituents, or of a tenant representing other tenants in a housing dispute
V) serve as a means of expressing something
VI) be characteristic of
VII) form or compose
VIII) be the defense counsel for someone in a trial
IX) create an image or likeness of
X) play a role or part
XI) perform (a play), especially on a stage
XII) describe or present, usually with respect to a particular quality
XIII) point out or draw attention to in protest or remonstrance
XIV) bring forward and present to the mind
XV) to establish a mapping (of mathematical elements or sets)

RESULT: IV) be a delegate or spokesperson for; represent somebody's interest or be a proxy or substitute for, as of politicians and office holders representing their constituents, or of a tenant representing other tenants in a housing dispute
Gold answer is: 7
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'particular' in the following text:  Cerenia does not represent a particular risk for people .

I) unique or specific to a person or thing or category
II) separate and distinct from others of the same group or category
III) surpassing what is common or usual or expected
IV) first and most important
V) exacting especially about details
VI) providing specific details or circumstances

RESULT: I) unique or specific to a person or thing or category
Gold answer is: 3
========

PROMPT: Which of the following senses is correct for the word 'people' in the following text:  Cerenia does not represent a particular risk for people .

I) (plural) any group of human beings (men or women or children) collectively
II) the body of citizens of a state or country
III) members of a family line
IV) the common people generally

RESULT: I) (plural) any group of human beings (men or women or children) collectively
Gold answer is: 4
========
